when the twilight breaks

LQCC - lobby
LQCC
🌙 WHEN THE TWILIGHT BREAKS / lobby
narrator 29-Jan-23 10:07 AM
On a fine winter's evening, the night after a large storm, the snow lay untouched across the expanse of the crater's edge. In the lodge, the detectives stand together as one unfamiliar face stood near the lobby. A young woman, who had previously introduced herself as Rosabelle Ellis, waves in your general direction. "Hello LQCC, I was just speaking with one of your detectives here... Frankie, was it? Well, I was just telling him about my request." She pauses, before waving her hand towards the snowmobile... (the dm does not know what they ride in the snow) that was waiting outside. "I need some help retrieving documents from an old research facility. I can explain further on the way there. It's getting quite late." @twilight @PINGO 🍊 Frankie

Rena Byrdford (she/her) BOT 29-Jan-23 10:15 AM
The woman sighs. Of course there would be work on a company vacation... why wouldn't there be? Well, she was getting tired of her cabinmates anyway so this was a welcomed distraction. Her niece and O'Connor gave her migraines but the bigger headache was... ugh... "So any reason you can't just go and get them on your own, lady?" Rena mirrors their client's pose, folding her arms and making herself look wider. "Something fishy going on there we need to worry about?" @narrator @PINGO 🍊 Frankie (who do i tag help)

It didn‚Äôt hurt to be prepared after all, as usual he was eager to know what was going on in depth within the realm of new anomaly research. Also an excuse to rummage through an abandoned research facility? It‚Äôs already past Christmas, but this was better than any gift. Well maybe there was. Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 29-Jan-23 10:25 AM
Covered in a large winter coat and mittens over his hands, Frankie waves over to the rest of the detectives, "Hey there! Thanks for coming along," He gives them a smile, "Err... It should be easy peasy honestly. It's just that the weather gets pretty bad at night and I think-- I believe that the research facility specifically had been researching an anomaly before? But it's been under control for years I don't think it'll be an issue, and if it is, miss Rosabelle will know how to deal with it!" "It's a pretty harmless anomaly from what I know, they've been researching it to test its healing capabilities." @twendychu 🌱 sylvester @twilight

I'm just a researcher, and a low level one at that. Erika (she/her) BOT 29-Jan-23 10:28 AM
Armed with a hefty amount of winter layers and her never-ending optimism, novice detective Erika is once again on the scene! It appears their client this time is a very pretty person, so she has little complaints about taking on this mission :salut: It's a bit disappointing to see (eugh) Frankie, of all people, leading when Erika is clearly the better choice in detective...but that's fine. She's fine. She'll prove herself to be a bonafide Detective with a capital D. And--oh. An anomaly with healing capabilities. If she were still the same "Erika" from a year ago, she'd leap to her feet at Frankie's words. A miracle, salvation. Proof of anomalies' holy nature, and their role in saving mankind. But after everything that Went Down (which Erika most definitely doesn't remember--nope, doesn't remember a single thing), the description makes her wary. She stays silent during their ride to the facility, observing their client with keen interest
SYLVESTER BOT 29-Jan-23 10:29 AM

Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 29-Jan-23 10:32 AM
"There was an accident, two something years ago.. Wasn't related to the anomaly as far as I know, they had people investigate it too and couldn't find any ties between the anomaly and the accident. The accident destroyed a lot of the research materials and injured several researchers at the time of the incident." He glances at Rosabelle for confirmation to see if his information is correct. @twendychu 🌱 sylvester
narrator 29-Jan-23 10:32 AM
Rosabelle smiles at the fact. "We're continuing the research at our main facility back at Meteor City. Frankie is right here, there was some sort of accident- it was in the papers and all- at the facility near the Crater's Edge, which paused any developments for quite a while. Though I suppose you can say that the research at this point has broken off into separate branches... it doesn't hurt to look into other methodologies." @twendychu 🌱 sylvester @PINGO 🍊 Frankie
Rena Byrdford (she/her) BOT 29-Jan-23 10:36 AM

narrator 29-Jan-23 10:42 AM
She pauses. "Well, there's been heightened anomalous activity in the region... that odd howling wind that's been going around the edge lately... I'm opting to just be safer now rather than sorry later." To tell the truth, she doesn't really know. In fact, she might not even need you guys in the first place... but this is her first field operation and it's weird out here. @AI KOtoba 💌🗿 olwen 🎺 rena @twilight mod post incoming
4
Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 29-Jan-23 10:42 AM
Cameron is silent on the journey, eyes cast towards the wintry scenes passing the window as she listens on, absorbing the snippets of the past that lead them now to be heading to a deserted lab facility. The stark whiteness holds a familiar discomfort, her mind is held in that military research base they travelled to many months ago. It was snowing there, too. How blood looks so vibrant against snow. Sylvester, a common denominator at both missions, readily asks questions to fill the air with chatter alongside Rena, who seems equally disgruntled as she is curious about what this retrieval should hold. It should be a quick job on paper: head in - locate the documents - return unscathed to enjoy the rest of their company retreat. But it's never so simple.
PINGO 🍊 Frankie 29-Jan-23 10:43 AM
The ride was mostly silent, though not to the fault of you or any of your coworker's social skills. The howling wind had made it hard to talk, and it seems that the wiser choice would be to focus on staying warm the entire way there. You begin to make out the facility's shadow admist the hefty snow, jutting out from the blanketed white of the ground. You notice a pair of skis resting near the doorstep. The doors and windows are frozen over and chilling to the touch, but with enough force you and the others manage to make it inside. The heavy door creaks with resistance when breaking free of its icy grips, as cold air rushes into the research facility. A young, brash voice calls out. "Woah! Dude that's cold.. Close the door-- fast! I don't want more of that cold air seeping in." He dons a ski jacket and goggles, with red hair and his face-- presumably flushed from the cold.

Liam BOT 29-Jan-23 10:43 AM

Saved me it did!" He pauses, "Were you guys lost too? Daaamn a whole group of you too.. and not one knows how to navigate this mountain..."
PINGO 🍊 Frankie 29-Jan-23 10:43 AM

saffron coelho. (he/she ) BOT 29-Jan-23 10:53 AM
with the world outside being cold and dark, the world Inside dingy and odd , saffron seems to not be in the best mood. though he hates to admit it, he has had little success when it came to talking with clients on these excursions ... too many people, too many voices, too many questions. everyone else got their word in far faster than he ever could, by virtue. and so, he's so far been resigning himself to quietly playing the role of the sponge, absorbing whatever he manages to catch tangentially, but the sight of liam seems to stir him out of his intense concentration. ... research facilities are rarely one just happens to stumble across. that's the entire point of putting them in odd locations. he does not give voice to this, though, instead him up and down. " ... i like your jacket. " he greets. " i pray it has been serving you well. did you happen to get lost during the storm yesterday evening ? is that how you landed yourself here ? " pause. " ah, where are my manners. saffron coehlo, with LQCC. it's a pleasure to meet you. and your name is ... ? " @PINGO 🍊 Frankie
Rena Byrdford (she/her) BOT 29-Jan-23 10:55 AM
The ride here didn't bother her much, she was quite used to it in fact. Huddled in the back of a mobile trekking into God only knows what. The howling wind only served to help her meditate on her thoughts, like white noise. At least Oniniwa's nagging was fruitful, she would've forgot her thermal socks otherwise but she'd damned well never admit it. She was in fact surprised to see Liam at the facility and... another bloke. Jesus Christ, did they not lock this place when they abandoned it? Why the hell do they have a civvy to take care of now ugh... "Of bloody course the driver doesn't wait for us... fuck..." Rena sighs again as she watches the snowmobile zoom off. "Never a dull day on the job..."

narrator 29-Jan-23 11:01 AM
Although dusty and seemingly unused, the interior of the facility was well lit and kept considerably warm, enough so that one would be free enough to shed the multiple layers of outerwear they had piled on if they so wished. With a coat hanger nearby, carefully dusted compared to the other pieces of furniture, Rosabelle placed her own winter coat on the racks before turning to the detectives around here. "I did forget to mention earlier, but there are two researchers here that are helping with the shutdown process. Right here is Dr. Aster Vaughan, one of the primary researchers at the facility here before it was closed two years prior. The other... I don't see her at the moment, but surely we'll see her soon." @twilight @PINGO 🍊 Frankie

Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 29-Jan-23 11:07 AM
She turns away from the tire tracks freshly dug into the carpet of snow, lips pressed into a thin line. "So we're stuck here too, then..." she mutters to herself, hands on her hips before shoving them into her pockets. Outside of Rosabelle (who she hopes has contact with this convoy), none of them has any contact details for returning to the lodge. No signal, no pick-up time, no rendezvous; they are sitting ducks whatever happens - or doesn't happen - here. All she can do is pray for the snowfall to cease for today, but from experience, god doesn't hear. Cameron follows suit, taking off her jacket to hang it on a separate peg. Her hat goes too.

11:44
A quick rundown of the situation and Eve nods her head. "Well, we're in the process of clearing out the facility, so any documents we can hand off we can do so. It's probably best if we split into two groups, one to search the upper floor and one to search the main floor, that'll probably cover every place that needs to be checked." She jerks her head towards the staircase, and then to the hall behind her. "Aster," she pauses, as if picking her words carefully. "If you'd like to go upstairs with half of the group, then I'll head down the hall with the other half. Our other guest is probably in one of these rooms. DETECTIVES! narrator 29-Jan-23 03:46 PM
time: late evening location: facility lobby weather: snowfall (edited)
15:51
There's the slow clicking of footsteps as one group meets another. The hall that had seemed so desolate before was full of individuals. Some who trusted each other, some who doubted, some who had an air of suspicion that clung to their bodies. It feels like quite the long walk actually, though in reality it wasn't that bad. The lights are still on, the heat is still working, and it seems like the lobby would be another empty room for them to check. If it wasn't for the slumped body reclining in one of the chairs. The detectives will recognize the individual as LIAM ASHFORD, the 25 (or was it 26?) year old skiier who had introduced himself earlier. A brightly colored jacket, and snow goggles that were still affixed to his head, even though they were indoors with no need for such protections. He was slouched on the recliner, head tilted to the side, with his eyes closed. His expression was... neutral. His body was cold. There was no sign of life. @twilight

narrator 29-Jan-23 04:41 PM
Without warning, the lights flicker before plunging the room into darkness. Perfect timing, one might have mused. How wonderful. In the end, these coincidences work when the stars align, or perhaps there was a puppet master pulling the strings from behind all along. It's hard to tell what's going on around you when you're blinded by the lights on the stage. For now, the only light was the illumination of the moon reflecting onto the snow. Even in the dark of night, the soft white sheen helped adjust your eyes to the darkness-- only so that you wouldn't trip over yourself. If not for the dire nature of it all, it could have been considered beautiful-- even poetic. The shimmering of the snow falling outside, the pure white of the light that filtered through the window. Half drawn curtains that shone a light directly onto the still body of Liam seated in the center of it all. A body too unnatural, too cold, too young, too unfortunate. Only a romantic could find beauty in the chaos of it all. Unfortunate this story is a tragedy. But perhaps there's a beauty in that as well. With the silence that fell as the lights were shut came the low hiss of gas as a canister rolled into the middle of the room. From where it came from, and who threw it was impossible to decipher. All the detectives knew was that there was a slow hissing noise, as something was released into the air. With their experience, everyone knew it was nothing good. The scent was sweet, an awful and heavy cloying scent that seemed to cling at everything it touched. A scent that hung onto the body and tried to drive itself into the soul, to mark a place so as to remind everyone that something was there, and that something would refuse to leave. A scent so sweet it burned the nostrils and watered the eyes. A lightheadedness that soon started to follow, and the slow thudding of bodies on the ground as one by one they succumbed to the intake of air.
16:41
It's hard to stay clearheaded when you're in a situation like this, even harder still to keep in mind the things you need to do most. Covering your mouth, your nose, it all feels useless when it feels as if the gas is seeping directly into your skin. Well, whatever happens... You can only hope that you'll open your eyes once again.
16:41
@twilight THANKS FOR DAY 1 !!! SEE YOU TOMORROW !

Aster BOT 29-Jan-23 12:18 PM
The staircase leading to the upper floor is rusted and creaky-- clear indications that the place hadn't had a much needed maintenance for a while. At the top, you find yourself facing a cozy lounge, or as cozy as it gets. To the right there are several doors with engravings marked on them, and a few cabinets to the left. In the middle of the room you see a coffee table and pictures of research awards framed overhead of the couch. Aster looks around apprehensively then sighs-- which they cover up with a cough as to not sound unenthusiastic. "This is the upper floor. It's mainly where the researchers stayed. 🌙 WHEN THE TWILIGHT BREAKS / main-floor
narrator 29-Jan-23 11:45 AM
YOUR DM FOR THIS ROOM WILL BE: @narrator
narrator 29-Jan-23 12:16 PM
Eve starts walking down the hall, past an assortment of shut doors, explaining the locations on the way there. "Most of the rooms here are empty offices and storages that have already been cleared out. We can start from the main room near the middle and branch out from there--" But as she speaks, another figure walks out from a brightly lit room, holding onto two mugs of steaming hot drinks, a smile plastered on his face. "Oh Evie, there you are. I made some hot chocolate, don't think they've expired yet. I was going to take some to the doc, but I've only got two hands and--" He takes a glance behind Eve, eyes widening at the sight. "Oh Rosey? You're here too? With friends?"

🌙 WHEN THE TWILIGHT BREAKS / saffron
NARRATOR BOT 30-Jan-23 10:16 AM

You are just nothing. And you lay here. Isn't that nice? Wasn't it tiring, being [Saffron Coelho], a rebel, a lover, and a fake. Wasn't it tiring, taking your life into your own hands, running away, always running, running, from the [home] that you left. Come back. Wake up. (You feel yourself [eroding], slowly [s l ip p i ng awa y]) Down, down deeper. CHOOSE: [SPEAK] [NO, I'D LIKE TO BE NOTHING FOR A LITTLE WHILE LONGER.] @MUTE 🐇 saffron
2
saffron coelho. (he/she ) BOT 30-Jan-23 10:33 AM
there is nothing delicate about the way saffron is going down. it is not something that comes as natural and familiar as slumber, where he'd simply sink, sink, sink, down into oblivion, into nothingness. no, this ... whatever it is, whatever it may be, is violent in its demand for submission. in the face of something far beyond him, he has become wax at mercy of a wicked, roaring flame, pieces of him melting and dripping and pooling underneath him until he is stripped down to the very wick of his soul. he is told to wake up, he is told to return, and he tries to become solid again by the sheer force of his will. he tries to [ SPEAK ], though he cannot hear the sound of his own voice, and thus, doesn't know what words his tongue has curled itself to say. his ears and lips, too, feel as though they have been thumbed away by this erosion of his own person. ( it wants him to be nothing. to become nothing. that's all he's ever been. and he's tired of it. )
NARRATOR BOT 30-Jan-23 10:49 AM
You are right. There is nothing delicate nor beautiful about nothing. Nothing is nothing. You of all people should know that, know what it is like to wish to be beautiful, tangible. You knew what a taste of nothing was like, to hear muted words, vibrations, you can scream, but your hearing fails you. Your ears have already left you with a taste of [NOTHING]. Mankind struggles as it does, aspires to live as beautifully as they can. Tell me, [SAFFRON COELHO], for you have looked death in the eye. Seen it for what it is. Is it beautiful? Are you beautiful? There is someone there. He wants to hear you: [SPEAK AGAIN. I WANT TO BE HEARD.] [NO. NO. I DON'T WANT TO BE SEEN LIKE THIS.] ROLL MAG @MUTE 🐇 saffron
saffron coelho. (he/she ) BOT 30-Jan-23 11:20 AM
i am beautiful. i am, i am, i am. because how could he say anything else ? how could he accept anything less ? how could he be anything less ? whereas the rest of mankind clamors with broken nails and bloodied teeth in its conquest to achieve a shred of beauty, saffron stands among the wreck, seemingly untouched. unphased. he has worked hard for this kind of visage. didn't he ? it was all his own doing. wasn't it ? ( to be beautiful is to be perfect. to be flawless, and untouchable, his father once said, as he cut a thin line down his spine to pull out saffron's wings from within himself. and your beauty will bring you safety. protection. my love, i promise you, i will make you into something even God would be willing to die for. ) ... there is nothing beautiful about death. death is dark, death is the end, what good does it do to make rotting tissue and unvoiced regrets easy enough to swallow. its hideousness, in itself, is what makes death worthwhile. it's why he creeps towards it, isn't it ? this little doll, with her soft hands and soft soles, wanting to be ruined. ... but saffron doesn't want to die. of course he doesn't. he doesn't want to be that hideous. death is nothingness. only something to witness, to behold, not to aspire to. only fools would go out of their way to do so. saffron wants to live. he wants to live, he wants to live, and the melt of his person once again attempts to come together in tightening threads. he wants to find a reason to live, and he will not find it six feet deep. a voice is calling to him, still, and he hopes it is not his father. he hopes .... he hopes ..... [ again. scream again. louder, this time. until proof of your desire makes your throat ache. ] MAG: 12

NARRATOR BOT 30-Jan-23 11:28 AM
TW: SLIGHT BODILY HARM You [SCREAM], and there's living proof of it. The vocal cords in your throat start [TEARING], the pain ripping you from inside out. You are heard, [SAFFRON COELHO]. You were nothing but now you are heard. The erosion clogs your throat, bubbling up through your sinuses and into your brain, clouding your vision. [YOU CANNOT SEE] Now it is [SIGHT] that is gone. saffron coelho. (he/she ) BOT 30-Jan-23 12:39 PM
it comes fast. too fast for saffron to dig manicured nails into the sockets of his skull, to rid himself of his own eyes out in an effort to make this blindness something within his control. once again, God snips one of five other tethers keeping him secured to his own body, and like a beautiful, marvelous, fragile, glimmering chandelier hanging from the ceiling, a jolt wracks his entire body when it snaps. saffron breathes in sharply, and it ... ( it doesn't hurt. it doesn't hurt. it doesn't hurt, but he feels as though he is losing yet another tether, in the form of his own lungs. he struggles to breathe. ) with no ears to hear, no eyes to see, and his body beginning to fracture into ones and twos and threes ... he trembles. for all his beauty, for all his grace, he trembles. like a child. like prey. sweat beads on his temples. saffron loathes the dark. he loathes feeling anything less than real. he can feel himself beginning to go cold, cold, cold, with something he does not want to give a name to, and he hates that, too. he hates it. blood tries to rush to the tips of his chilling fingers, needling its way through freezing veins. the hairs on his neck raise as he breathes again, tensing up, and it's as though he is punished for wanting to live, because it burns. something else burns, too, against skin turning to ice. it comes, feeling away at another tether and giving it a tug, and saffron's breath hitches. it is gentle. it does not mean to hurt. come. come back. there is only one person in the waking world that has ever come so close. who has ever touched him like this. he is someone who doesn't belong here, really. by saffron's side or in his thoughts. he is too soft, too easy -- " i'll protect you if anything happens, like letting myself get eaten. " what a joke. he laughs, even, and the glass shards of his own vocal cords are being pushed further into his throat.
12:40
only fools would rush to their death like that. only idiots would think of someone else in the face of death, and throw their life away. that man ... he doesn't belong here, and he knows it. he's fragile. he's weak. he is still just a boy, still so naive to think that something like " sacrifice " is worth anything more than a sentence in his obituary. ... but. but. he is a boy of promise. saffron learned as much, in the home he spent his childhood in. in a quaint, rustic kitchen that smelled like years worth of love in the form of baked bread, made from a family recipe. under the canopy of a giant oak tree that boy used to play in when he was smaller, none the wiser. that boy promised to stay. he did. even if he didn't, saffron's own curiosity has made him hard to let go of. he wants to know what it takes to live in such a way that you allow yourself to be torn apart so easily. he wants to help him not make it so. ( saffron died once, you know. somewhere in a distant dream. he did not see the highlight reel of his own life spinning before his very eyes. he saw a smile then, wide, toothy, warm in the november chill. it kept him even warmer than the blood he had been soaked in. warmer than the sun. it almost burns. but saffron needs to burn. he needs to live. ) like the rest of the common man, his arms lift in spite of their heaviness, reaching towards the owner of these gentle, searing hands, wishing to set himself alight. ( almost desperately so. ) [ frankie. is that you ? ]

saffron coelho. (he/she ) BOT 30-Jan-23 03:35 PM
a castle made of sand crumbles easily when it meets the crash of the ocean wave, no matter how brash or gentle it is. it is just within the nature of sand to dissolve, dissolve, dissolve, till something that used to be so intricate and grand becomes merely another mound on the shore. and saffron ... well. he loses himself to the tide the moment it comes as a pair of strong, shaking arms, wrapping themselves around his ever crumbling frame. it's a desperate move. tight, tight, tight. suffocating, even. from what he's heard, what he's seen, what he is now feeling at the brink of oblivion ... that's the only way frankie seems to know how to love things. in frankie's effort to keep him from falling apart, the man squeezes the cold out of saffron's veins, and oh, what must he look like ? seeing only pure darkness, he could only imagine it. the two of them, together, in sickly sanguine. frankie squeezes so much more than that out of him, too. pain. agony. strength. he's sure that if he had any more feeling in his body, it would hurt horrendously. that this love of his would hurt so, so, so terribly. and frankie does love him. he knows. he's never doubted it. frankie can't help but love people like the hammer loves the nail, and that, too, is so, so incredibly boyish of him.
15:36

There was nothing the anomaly could have taken from you in the first place. [SAFFRON COELHO], you were empty from the start. Yet, it is still satisfied. You'd understand the desperation it felt to live. You'd understand the desire it burnt with. It no longer wishes to [EAT] you. There is nothing to take. [Come back.] It coaxes you. Your senses return, one by one. Somehow, you feel a smile against your skin. > [WAKE UP] ... The warmth against your hand is still there when you emerge into the real world. Frankie Mane is holding your hand. Even in his unconscious state, his expression is [peaceful]. It all comes back to you. Moments before your consciousness slipped, amidst the chaos, amidst the yelling, a warmth enveloped you. His familiar voice calling your name, attempting to shield you from whatever comes next. Wordlessly, he utters something into your ear? [What was it?] Frankie Mane is warm. He is alive. But he does not move. He does not wake up. YATTA FIN FOR TODAY THANK U FOR PLAYING

Rena Byrdford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 10:54 AM
Forward. You have to keep moving. Any moment's indecision might cost more than seconds chipped off your watch. Idling meant to sink, to give up. So why was she so paralyzed by the decision in front of her? * Music. The one thing that grounded her, that connected her to the world. The only way she knew to express her feelings to others sincerely. She listened to the familiar melody for a little more. *Goedicke's Concert Etude, Op. 49. https://youtu.be/IwoWs3cYqP0 Arranged for a trumpet solo, a warm welcoming sound yet there was some lingering depths in the strings, a tension so tight that it could cut yet welcoming and familiar to her all the same. Her heart yearns to go towards it, towards the melodies calling to her like a siren song. But in her gut she knew what she had to do. The path laid out for her was obvious. Too long had she tried to escape into the concertos and fugues of sheet music, it was time she faced the music head on. Because she ran, she's lost her sister. She failed Liam. She's pushed away her niece. She was going to lose her nephew too if she wasn't careful. She was going to lose everyone. [ She needed to protect what she still had. ] Before she loses herself.

NARRATOR BOT 30-Jan-23 11:05 AM
CW: DEATH DESCRIPTION You continue walking down this path, to protect what you still had. There was still a reason to fight. There was still a reason why you're alive, it compels you, it pierces you, like a stake through your heart. The warm sound of orchestral wiles and trumpet solos fades away as you continue walking, or perhaps, it is you who is losing your sense of [hearing], each step on this path fading to a dull thud. You can lose the music. You've lost so much already. It isn't new. [RENA BYRDFORD], why do you fight? Are you a [GOOD] person? [GOEDICKE'S CONCERT ETUDE OP. 49] fades completely as you come to a stop. In front of you, you see [HER]. Beautiful as she was, even in death. IT'LL COME IN HANDY FOR FUTURE BATTLES: [I REFUSE TO WIELD A BLADE FORGED IN BLOOD] [A WEAPON IS A WEAPON. MY HAND WAS MADE TO WIELD THEM.] (edited)
1
Rena Byrdford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 11:26 AM
The silence was new. For the longest time, that was all she wanted. Telling her rowdy friends to lower their voices, telling the annoying people downtown to shut the hell up. Yet when it came to music, she never complained no matter the genre.
Why did she fight?
Why wouldn't she? She had people to protect and if that meant she had to go through hell to do so, why wouldn't she? Because it's all she was good for, all she knew how to do. Brute force and power to her sister's brains. Yet why did you, in your all knowingness, fall in love with that man? ... maybe she fought out of spite. An excuse to exact revenge on those who wronged her and family. As repentance for her inaction that lead to... Rena looks at Aina's corpse. This wasn't the first time she's seen her like this. And this wouldn't be the last time.
Was she a good person?
She would like to think so. That she was doing out of selflessness. That she protected because it was out of the pure and utter goodness of her heart. That she were a hero to those in need. That.. That... maybe she thinks that because it's what she's been told by others. Aina told her that before. A long time ago now... It's funny isn't it? They say time heals all wounds eventually but its been bloody over a decade yet there's still a bleeding scar over her heart. Rena stands over Aina's corpse. [ A weapon is a weapon. ] Her heavy hand rests on the sword's hilt. [ And her hands were made to wield them. ] She pulls the sword out carefully trying not to disturb her sister's corpse too much. She was just a weapon, huh?
3
NARRATOR BOT 30-Jan-23 11:49 AM
This sword is AINA's heart. Wield it well, for this heart was the very thing that destroyed it's previous holder. [LOVE], or so they say, was AINA's final demise, lest it be your own in the end too. You pay your brief respects to her. This is indeed not the first time you have seen such a scene, and this will not be the last time you mourn her either. Time is sacred. There is still more to be done. It's time to go. The [PULSE] of the sword emanates a searing [HEAT] into your hand with every step you take. It beats in sync with your own heart. This is someone who had loved you. Seen you for what you are. Knows what you must do. There is a figure blocking your way. It's [EVE]. She is a killer. STRIKE HER DOWN. AINA WOULD UNDERSTAND. The sword pulses once more, in time with the blood rushing through your veins. Red hair and a bright smile flashes through your vision. This is what [EVE] had taken. It's time to do what you should have done back then. CHOOSE: [A WEAPON IS A WEAPON AND I WILL USE IT TO DO THE RIGHT THING] [KEEP MOVING. IT IS NOT THE TIME TO WIELD THE WEAPON.] Eve smiles at you. @AI KOtoba 💌🗿 olwen 🎺 rena
Rena Byrdford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 12:24 PM
Heavy was the heart she wield in her hand. Such is the burden of the one left behind, the one forced to forge forward. Even in her death, she kept her safe. Is what she told herself to keep herself sane. The burn from the bubbling heat of the sword did not bother her. Her knuckles white against the steel, she wasn't going to lose the gift she was given. It's time to go. Don't be afraid. She wasn't... was she? She had no choice. Rena continued on. Where was the end? Where was she going? She didn't know. "You don't want to know." She didn't want to know. She could only hear the throbbing heartbeats from their synchronized pulse in her ears. She wanted to believe it was Aina with her, she always knew what to do. She always knew what to say and how to guide her. "Because you don't want to be liable for your actions to come." Because Aina would understand. ...Eve. The woman they had been looking for stood in front of her. The woman that housed the parasite according to the doctor. If she killed her, she could end it all. But was that the right thing to do? Was that a just enough reason to do something like that? There had to be a way to fix this without wasting any more human lives. "Rena, dear, don't you see?" Liam comes to mind. "You can end this and save everyone. A small sacrifice to make for the lives of your friends." The grip around the sword tightens painfully. The heartbeats roaring at a quick tempo, counting it was the one thing that kept Rena from leaping to action immediately. Her jaws clenched, teeth grinding on each other uncomfortably. Taking one life was a small price to pay for the safety of many and if that means she had to dirty her hands...... [ Then she will do the right thing. ]

NARRATOR BOT 30-Jan-23 12:45 PM
Nothing is ever so simple. If the world could have been sorted into small compartments of rights and wrongs, judged so easily with a small sacrifice, would AINA have felt the pain the way she did? Emotions and logic bear the mind, the soul, the body, in messier ways than simple things such as science and common sense can figure out. Yet, despite all this, we choose to make decisions, to love, to fight. Is it because you are [GOOD] and you are [HUMAN]? Or is it because you are [ARROGANT] believing that in such a simple story. Of love. Perhaps EVE is weak, her body tearing apart and dissipating into the shadows. Her smile does not falter as you do, heat roaring in your veins, AINA's heart powering your swing. It is so easy. To judge. To destroy. You feel ALIVE. More than ever before. This is what it means to live, the adrenaline, the guilt, the outrage. The [WEAPON] in your hand erodes a little bit. Rena Byrdford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 01:09 PM
It's because she wanted to believe. To believe she was good. How could she face herself, no, face others? If she admitted that she was a bad person... what would become of her? As Eve's visage and the sword in her hand fades, she can't help but laugh at herself. Of course, of course it wouldn't be so easy! "You always wanted the easy way out." The laugh turns sour, twisted even. To feel ALIVE? Was this truly what was missing from the day to day? Bloody nothing got fixed, didn't it? Rena eyes the darkness and she was sure it stared back at her. The throbbing heartbeat in her ears, did she truly hear that or felt it? Rena could barely tell the difference anymore. The sides of her lips turned upwards ever so slightly. Whether it was out of disbelief or rage or insanity, even Rena didn't know. Such an uncharacteristic expression, a sneer that did not match her own befitting of the situation she found herself in. It was cut short seeing what the anomaly decided to present her with next: herself. ".........." She stares at herself for what felt like forever as if met with a complete stranger. It was so different from facing a mirror. Yet... there was again no question what the right(?) decision was for her. [ She charges at herself with intent to KILL. ]

Rena Byrdford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 02:02 PM
A job's a job. Orders were meant to be followed. Mindlessly. She was a weapon, was she not? But how can a weapon be any of the things a good person was meant to be? Maybe deep down she knew but she had been trying to convince herself otherwise for so long and now it's finally bubbled to the surface. She felt seen. But not in a comforting way that you felt understood but rather in a intrusive way where it felt violating, an invasion of your personal bubble. This thing has found all her weaknesses and it did not pull its punches. She wanted to scream. Yet nothing came. She wanted to cry. Yet none fell. Ragged breaths and cold sweat was all she could muster as she watched herself die beneath her. Watching oneself die... cold was one way to describe her feelings about it. She would never admit but maybe, just maybe, she wished *that she had been the version of herself to have met that end. Because it was easier to die than to continue on like this. Maybe her sister was right. But Rena could not accept that. There were others that needed her. *How far will she go? "..." Her eyes widened at the sight of her niece in front of her. The pinprick... the happiness... but was that still Olwen? Wouldn't she be doing Loraine a favour if that was no longer the Olwen she knew? Was it not her responsibility to take care of it? As her aunt? She wanted to stop. Yet she continued forward. She wanted... She wanted....... [ She wanted to be a good person. ]

Rena Byrdford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 02:49 PM
What was she without the titles she had gathered? Who was Rena Byrdford if she was none of those things? If she wasn't a fighter, a soldier, a protector.... a good person... what was she? Could she even be just herself if she didn't know what she was anymore without the lies she had fed herself all these years? Can Rena Byrdford be someone to make things right without the guiding forces she's been using as crutches all these years? She couldn't do it. [ She cannot look at Olwen like this. ] Even if Olwen could not see her like this, Rena could not look into what was once her niece's eyes as she finished the deed. The guilt will sit with her forever. It would die with her and she would let it turn her into something worse if it meant she didn't have to watch Olwen die by her own hands. Surely everyone would understand, right? Aina would. She had to feed herself yet another lie... but this time it doesn't help soothe the pain. In the end, the blind one was you, Rena Byrdford.

NARRATOR BOT 30-Jan-23 04:08 PM
The voice laughs. It is a nice, clear sound. Perhaps this is what love sounds like. For an anomaly capable of taking, and taking, and taking, it has a beautiful voice. Perhaps this is what it meant, when it said it would make you holy again. Fix you. Wouldn't you like to see something beautiful again? Ah. Which melody was it? The one you played for Aina back then. I will play it for you as a parting gift. Though I am not the one leaving, I will stay with you forever, but it's time to say goodbye to the Rena you knew. To the Rena who couldn't do anything. Warmth envelops you and the voice stops. It is silent, and then the light, familiar melody plays in yet again. You close your eyes. [It's time to rest, soldier. There is always more to be done. narrator 30-Jan-23 10:48 AM
It's familiar to you at this point, the cycle and twists that anomalies like to take as they spin you around for their own twisted desires. To use you like a puppet in their own experiment to see what direction you'll move in, or how high you'll jump when prompted. So that's what you would expect. Another mind-bending, mind-warping anomaly that takes you from one place to the next, to show you visions of the things you love most-- the things you hate most. To dangle in front of you the desires of the heart and the mind. The answers to questions you want to ask anyone who would give you an answer. The pain was unexpected. The sticky feeling that clogged your throat and made it hard to breathe, the stinging feeling in your nose as you had no choice but to breathe in the fumes. Perhaps you'll wonder for a moment what the components of the gas was, the combination of elements that could cause such a feeling. It's a little too late for that now though. There's a stinging feeling in your mind, and an itchy feeling in your bones, as if there's something that's trying to melt you down from the inside out. You don't think you can move. Your limbs feel like lead. @twendychu 🌱 sylvester TYT BTW!
SYLVESTER BOT 30-Jan-23 11:21 AM
Yes, those were the expectations. Given the malleable nature of human perception and the many foibles built into the fabric of the complex pile of overly ambitious cells rattling around in the cavity of the skull, it was to no surprise that with the otherworldly qualities of anomalies the brain just starts making things up. Translating the incomprehensible into easily digestible bites of regrets and stinging, lingering thoughts. In easy dreams and sweet wish fulfillment. Of course expectation breeds complacency, and perhaps that was what eventually leads to downfall. Pain, too, was to be expected. Slightly harder to write off though. Burning, choking, something disintegrating your insides. On the bright side at some point deep enough in the human body there were no more nerves to feel the cells dissipating into their base components so thankfully if you ever were tossed into a pit of highly concentrated acid, once it digs in deep enough into you, you at some point you‚Äôd stop feeling it. Of course you‚Äôd be dead by then. Death didn‚Äôt hurt, it didn‚Äôt do much of anything. No. False statement, not proven, the deaths felt through some anomalies delusions are not the certified answer. Unreliable. Focus on what was there‚Äî Cloying sweetness. Burning. The unwilling body will have to succumb eventually to a mind that cannot stop. Sylvester tries to move his fingers, and if they listen, try to touch the ground. Any distinguishing surface qualities? Hard linoleum? Stone? Dirt? @narrator
narrator 30-Jan-23 11:52 AM
It's the warm, sinking feeling of the dirt that's softly been pushed out of the way. The decay and decomposition of the body as you find yourself laid comfortably to rest as the shhk, shhk, of the shovel piles dirt on your body. Your glasses slowly becoming dirtier as the flicks of dirt and gravel lands on top of the once-pristine lens. Vision clouding as the warmth of the earth overtakes you and-- No, it's the feel of the cold hard porcelain tile that brings you back to reality. Cool against your fingers, and just as cool against your cheek. At least that's able to ground you... if only for a moment. You take in a breath. Did you forget? Hydrogen sulfide tends to fall, that's why children were often more at risk. The gas invades your lungs, a sticky feeling that seemed to rumble inside your lungs... almost as if it was alive. For a moment, you might have wondered what it would be like to take a bit as a sample to investigate back in your lab. Always the inquisitive mind. And for a moment. You remember. You remember? Right... you remember. In the back of your head there was that scientific formula... hydrogen sulfide produced as a byproduct of combining anomalous sample 468-E2K and component B2394-KE. Where did these numbers come from? It felt as if it was something you managed to dig up from your subconscious. From when or how... well that's a little too much thinking for a situation like this, but you never let that stopped you from finding an answer. You looked into this long ago, a endless query that rose again as you sought answers to a truth you wanted to find. Answers that would leave you finally at peace. Questions to the age old question of immortality---- Was it you who remembered? Or are you remembering something someone else would remember... What question are you trying to answer? @twendychu 🌱 sylvester
SYLVESTER BOT 30-Jan-23 12:08 PM

narrator 30-Jan-23 01:32 PM

narrator 30-Jan-23 04:14 PM
The words fall upon deaf ears, carried away by the wind as you can feel the chill of the winter night settling in. You sit there by the cabin door, too afraid to open the door, too afraid to pry it open to reveal what scared you the most. You are a person if there is someone who cares for you. It's this question that lingers in the back of your mind while you sit on the steps outside, the snow slowly starting to settle on top of your head. You wait there, seated alone, in hopes that the door will open by itself, and you'll see the familiar warm smile that you've grown accustomed to greet you. Waiting for him to open the door and welcome you inside with a seat by the fireplace to warm yourself up. There's a comfort that you two have shared before, speaking together casually as you walk through the grocery store to pick ingredients for a quick dinner, or the moments you have when staring at another piece of art on the wall. There's the moment of silence that you two share when you stare into each other's eyes from a distance, with words left unsaid not because anyone was too shy to say anything, but simply because the moment didn't require it. What if that comfort was never meant for you in the first place? It's that feeling that everything could shatter all at once that causes the chill in your bones... not the snowfall on this silent winter's night. If you closed your eyes, you could imagine the dream falling apart. If you open your eyes, you'll see that the door is still shut behind you. narrator 30-Jan-23 05:03 PM
If it was only so easy to receive an answer to the questions that plague you. If you open the door, and he greets you with a warm hug and a kiss on the cheek, will it quell the doubt that you feel in your heart? Will it kill the voice lingering in the back of your mind? If you open the door, and face an illusion of what you see as yourself, will it cause you to give up on your life and throw it all away? You've made it this far... are you really willing to give it all up? Regardless of what happens, there's always room for doubt when it comes to an anomalous situation like this, a figment of your memory and imagination manifested in a space that felt real. By what parameters will you measure this answer. What kind of solution is the answer that is impossible to verify. Is it just to quell the doubt in your heart? Or do you want to live in a make-believe illusion, to accept the falsehoods that line up with your ideals, to live a life that is a lie for what you believe? You feel the incessant nagging in the back of your mind, as your hands clench against the door and you open it to find your answer... A mirror. Was this a cruel joke? To show you a reflection of your snow-covered self, the flakes starting to melt on top of your shoulders as you entered the warm room. You stared into the mirror to see yourself as you are now. Sylvester R. McKinley. Researcher. Scientist. Investigator. Inquisitive Mind. A doctor. A maniac. A genius. To you, a person is the mind. The memories that they remember and have formulated throughout childhood. Your hypothesis isn't the one that is wrong. It's the initial query.
17:03
Who is Sylvester R. McKinley? Sylvester is a detective at an agency that specializes in investigating anomalous incidents called LQCC. They're well known in the company, experienced enough to have been on several difficult, and successful operations. They managed to save lives, they managed to contain anomalies. They managed to do quite a number of unimaginable things. These are experiences that are unique to him. Unique to him, and him only. You, and your identity, is shaped by the memories that have only been able to be forged by you. His place in the world, would never be the same as yours. In fact, you'll never know if it was better. Or worse. These are things that were out of your control. The guilt may lie in your heart, but did you ever go out of your way to steal it? Did you wrestle it away from his hands? Did you kidnap him yourself in order to situate yourself into his perfect little life? There are children who are swapped at birth. You don't blame them. Why do you blame yourself? If he even showed up... what would you do?

narrator 30-Jan-23 05:52 PM
You stare into the mirror, the shattered pieces that slowly fall one by one. You can see the hint of a smile in what's reflected, though you're not sure if it's the warping of the glass or if it's a twisted smile of your own, or if it's a smile of understanding... of forgiveness. For a moment, you pause to think what he would have been like. Perhaps kind-natured? Would he forgive you? Do you want to forgive yourself? At the end of the day, is there anyone who will be kinder to yourself... than you? You, who understands the struggle you've experienced, you, who understands the pain you would have felt. You, who are able to follow the thought process that would bring you from point A to point B in only the way that you would have done it. The first piece of the puzzle, is to forgive yourself. If you were able to forgive yourself, wouldn't he be able to do the same? You are both Sylvester McKinley, but you are LQCC detective Sylvester McKinley. That's what makes all the difference. It's not a question of who wins or who loses, who takes on the identity and who crumbles into the dust. It's a question of how you want to move forward, now that the glass is broken in front of you. You feel as if you're crumbling, but it never means everything is lost. Rotten foundations should be rebuilt, lest the buildings cave in later. You can cry, wrack yourself in sobs, but there are no more glass shards in your arm, not this time. They fall to the ground, turning into powder that looks just like snowfall. Gentle on the hands, a soft caress that seems to explain again and yet again that there is no pain that needs to be felt. A brush against your cheeks that the wind brings as a soft caress, the glass that slowly melts into the snow as the wind eases upon the dead of night. There's no longer an cabin to look for, no longer any mirror in front of you.
17:52
Just yourself in this snowy expanse, as you feel the chill start to settle in your bones. The evening drags on, and pulls your heavy lids into slumber. Close your eyes, here's a lullaby. May you begin to heal as the pieces start to shift together. You don't need to be saved. You never needed to be saved. All you needed to do was forgive. He would forgive you.

🌙 WHEN THE TWILIGHT BREAKS / cameron
narrator 30-Jan-23 10:33 AM
[ mechanisms ] throughout this process, you will have two options to navigate through the course of this journey [ when prompted ]. 1. [ a flat 1d20. ] let the die choose your fate. ;take your chances. 11+ is a save. 10 and below is a fail. 2. [ a narrative explaination. ] your willpower and strength are all you have. ;the catch? you don't know what saves you and what makes you worse. ultimately, it will be your decisions that affect the course of your actions. ultimately, you choose if you live or die. feel free to pick whichever method you'd like to use whenever prompted. nothing is ever set in stone. ADDITIONAL NOTES: - please make all rolls in this channel There's the slight pinprick that you feel on your body, an insertion of a needle, akin to a vaccine. Something that should save you, should help you feel better. But right now, you just feel awful. The burning sensation lingers in your throat, clings to the inside of your mouth-- dry and raspy, no voice manages to escape your lips as you try to speak. Instead, your body is dragged along the floor, away from everyone else. Once again you find yourself alone. In a hazy state of mind where no one else can follow. You don't think you can move... ROLL MAG. @nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd
2
Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 10:54 AM
What is a life without pain? Emotional, physical, psychological - Cameron can't remember such a thing now. What doesn't kill you makes you stronger, they say. She can attest to that philosophy with her ceaseless pursuit of surviving. Day after day, after year, after more than a decade now since the fateful day she sold her soul to the military. That's the Rutherford way. Her accomplishments, accolades, a life of service - a phantom never to be ushered in civilians' company. Most days, behind the cheery persona she clings to for identity, Cameron feels no different to a ghost operating this body of hers. A body she's locked into immobilisation as it's unceremoniously pulled away to her only support line. Her vision is blurry; her body, heavy from the weight of the sins she can no longer uphold. The disgustingly saccharine scent clings to her nose and throat and burns her eyes. She's been tear-gassed before, but this is different. Her body burns from the epicentre of the prick. How ironic that her foreshadowed concerns pay her no benefits now. All the experiences she's harboured to keep her alive to this point - how they played no role in saving them. Help. Is what she wants to say. Cry out. But her voice is snuffed out before she can even attempt.

narrator 30-Jan-23 11:07 AM
This is probably one of the worst positions to be in, isn't it. A lack of agency, a lack of ability. Everything you had worked so hard for crumbling into dust before you right now. A couple tears, a couple of nights away, and you'd be able to bounce back. Heartier and healthier than ever. But the strings were bound too tight today, and strings that taut could snap at any moment. It's the tension that causes your body to stir, to clench your teeth and grit through it all. The opportunity that could arise so you could move again... But it's impossible to be a hero everyday. You weren't a hero today. You already watched one more lifeless body be laid to rest. A victim. One that's been shattered and broken once again. You've managed to piece yourself together, bound by gold to fill in the cracks, tied together so that you could stand tall once again. A figure that glimmered with the sunlight, one that shone proudly in the face of adversity. But how many times can you find yourself shattered on the ground again? How many more pieces can you continue to pick up without losing them? But it's just as easy to let go. Escape. Move on. You can feel a numbing feeling from where the needle hit you. Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 11:55 AM
Impossible odds. Impossibility is Cameron's commonality. Like watching a faint jump on a cardiogram after a flat line, releasing a gasp for air after swallowing water, a bullet missing vitals by a hair, finding an opening when surrounded by enemy fire. It's easy to rationalise true danger when in an environment that fosters it; she doesn't have to feel so strange when she must discretely patrol new locations for any potential vulnerabilities in its defences when visiting, or have to plan exit routes when trying a new restaurant, or feel her hands clam up when out in the open public to enjoy New Years celebration, or need to know where the nearest clock is to keep track of the time. There's no easy way to turn off survival mode. Its alarm is always on. The pendulum sways between living and dying. The string is worn and frayed and teeters further to one side than the other. But impossibility is all she knows - It's a comfort. To know, against all odds, a victim can be a hero for others. Giving up here is the easy route. How she would love the easy route; to simply close her eyes and fall dull and numb to the pain of surviving. She does, for a moment. Close her eyes. Imagines her friends and family waiting on the other side, if one exists. No one else is coming to her rescue. She thinks about her friends and family here, living; she was supposed to call her mother when she got back inside. She thinks of Zeke waiting in their cabin for her to come back - he's probably bothering Ernie right now, huh? How long have they been gone? Time is slipping away again. It stretches with each shallow intake of air that keeps her alive. Cognizant. She has to be her hero. Cameron attempts to wiggle her toes and fingers in her state of paralysis. How alive was she? Cameron wants to look at what is pulling her away. Making the unknown known will ease her mind. @narrator

Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 12:54 PM
Like sand passing between fingers, it's difficult to contain her shattering frame. The fault lines grow, every scar marring her flesh connected to fragment this mortal coil that she so desperately tries to hold together with a thin thread of agency. She wants to die. She doesn't want to die. She wants to sleep, she wants to wake. The binary pulls her apart, as does the past and present that overlays and crashes into her like violent tides against worn, battered rocks. They, too, crumble into the sea and drift away. Replenishing the sea bed's sand, a new form. It's harder to think now as her mind crumbles too in its weariness, maybe it was easier to. Maybe it's better if secrets die on her lips, in this facility, just like the atrocities committed inside these walls - if she was still inside, to begin with. Secrets she digs deeper and deeper to hide, a trench, a grave - it was safer that way. For their sakes, for the nation's security, for hers. To be naked and bare, shivering and trembling, the vulnerability forces bile into her mouth in all its bitterness to counteract the sweet poison of her surroundings. Memories play, scattered, like viewing frozen scenes in a photo album. She loves photography for that reason, the control, the ability to capture a distinct moment in time to relive forever. Flushed cheeks, warm hands, a gentle kiss, her forehead grows hot where his lips pressed. If she could smile, she would in this cosy scene. But roses. How she hates roses. Their scent sends her into nausea. Their attachment to the artificial of Valentine's day is met with vitriol. The number of times he's heard her rant every year when the commercial day of love returns - he's always so attentive. The parasite feeds on memories. She remembers those words now. It's ... inside her. Get up - get up- Cameron musters all her strength to sit up, get up. She's not drifting again into a sea of darkness. Not again. She has to do this time alone. She needs to. <@1

@narrator
narrator 30-Jan-23 01:08 PM
You hate roses, you can't eat chocolate. So whose hands are these that carefully pick out a bundle from the florists, that pick out a selection at the store. Ones that you were sure to share. Hands grazing lovingly over the selection as you pause before each and every choice so that you could make the perfect pick. For a perfect night. If you close your eyes shut, you can see the vision in your mind. Even as the nausea doesn't seem to fade away. A careful hesitation, a desire to make things perfect. The rush as you slip on the frost of a February afternoon, running as fast as you can to see --- . Whose memories are you recalling? Surely they weren't... they were? You sit up and wake from the darkness to sit in... the darkness. There's a scratching feeling that seems to claw at you from the inside out. A burning feeling causing your body's temperature to rise above what you feel is normal. It's uncomfortable, it's painful honestly. It's irritating. It's something you've felt before. It's a sensation you've never experienced.
13:08
What is the point in fighting so hard. What did you end up getting out of it? You'll get up again, you'll crash down again. At this point, no one knows why you fight any longer. You've done so much. Don't you deserve to rest? Everyday you force yourself on your feet one more time and push forward. There's no end in sight, no finish marker for you to look at and cross. No one to clap for you. It's a desolate and thankless journey, one that only continues to press down and weigh on your soul as you try to stand again.
13:08
There's a play in the theater that continues to roll, day by day without fail. A story of the life of Cameron Rutherford, and in it... the only audience is you, by yourself. You keep all these secrets by yourself, you can't share them with anyone, and all you can do it grit your teeth and play the tape over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over.

Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 01:48 PM
She doesn't want to see these images burned into her retinas. Those hands are hers but not, an uncanniness in this reasonably conceivable scenario. The puppet's hands scour through the options of bundled crimson roses that sit against the shelves to seek the most perfectly vibrant red among the selection. As red as the blood that splattered the haphazardly cleaned lab benches - that coated her hands when she applied pressure to her seeping abdomen, self-inflicted. That soiled camo taking a life or futilely saving another. There is a force beyond her personal will. She is merely a puppet, and her strings contort her limbs in a new dance for this play, where she watches as the sole audience member and actress on the stage. Over and over and over and over, new puppet masters take their position to use her for their needs and discard her. Over and over and over, the porcelain weakens from wear, and the strings too. Rewound, tort, loosened holds tighten. Each time she waits for its satisfying snap. To crumple against the floor. To have the curtains finally close to thunderous silence. But it never comes. Because when she looks up to see who truly controls her, continues to replace her strings, smooths out her cracks, and dusts her off to perform again, Cameron watches back. The show must go on even if she is weary. As there is no return once stepping off its polished floors. Her body burns in the darkness, on the stage, in the void as if ignited within - a torturous existence. But she feels. And feeling means she is still here. She promised herself a year ago to allow herself to feel again. Feel anything without restraint. White heat surges through in its clawing, sharp slashes that tear through her being and cause her to lurch and heave on her unsteady legs. But she remains upright, stubborn, hands clenching her knees for stability. The threads wind tightly to hold her together lest her vitality splatters on the ground for it to feed on further.
13:55
It's disorienting, the noise, the darkness. There's no sign of knowing where one is. Where anything is. What time it is. Why she is. Breathe, just breathe... in...out...her lungs shudder with each inhale and exhale. Against the increasing weight of her choices, indecisions, actions, inactions. It hurts, being crushed. Any second, her ribs could give into the pressure and cave in. She could give into the pressure and cave in as her fragmented mind would want in theory. Her existence is a thankless one, in theory. But that...wasn't true.
13:59
It wasn't. So many have touched her life, as much as she's touched theirs. She wants to think about happy memories, to burn a new candle of solace against the encroaching darkness. But she closes her eyes instead, embracing this ache and pain. To survive, she couldn't think. She will compartmentalize, just as she always has. The pain is only mental. The situation is only mental. She can't give it more memories to devour. She will starve it.

- FAIL 2/?? You want to starve it. You want to prevent it from coming any closer to you, but what choice do you have in the matter? The pain is mental. The pain is physical. Is there a flush in your body as you tense up at the feeling? You can compartmentalize all you want, you can try to protect parts of yourself, as much as you need, but you need to bring yourself back to the present, you need to bring yourself back and feel what is happening now. Because once you stop thinking, all you can feel is the slow erosion of your body, the way you feel as if you're being removed from your physical self once more.
14:27
To you, a person is comprised of their soul, their emotions, their feelings. What makes you Cameron Rutherford is not your duty, nor your name, nor is it the responsibilities that weigh themselves down upon your shoulders. It's how you feel, your desire to survive. The happiness that you feel when you remember the lives that you have touched, will touch, and continue to touch. The small banter that comes as a result of your lively nature. The connections you feel with other people, even if only momentarily. It's the smile you share, the laughter that fills the air, the chuckle that you hold back just to save another person a little bit of face. In the end, your emotions make you a person. So how could you even bear to shove those away. Your will to survive is like none other, going so far as to cut off a rotting limb if that's what it takes. The stakes are getting dire, you probably have one more chance... one more opportunity. Out of how many though. Cameron Rutherford thinks for a moment, if one plan failed, surely there was something else that she would be able to do. Something she could pull off in order to save herself from dying a meaningless death. Of course, there's nothing that could be done without making a sacrifice... but sometimes a sacrifice was better than giving it all up-- especially if that sacrifice was only limited to herself. So she pauses, if only for a moment, to think about the rotting limb she could cut, the one that seemed to be cloying at her right now. To save the essence of Cameron Rutherford, she could give up her memories of... > of Zeke > of her duty > her expertise of your choosing It's a hollow feeling, to make some kind of sacrifice this way... but it was better than dying. Or you could fight. You could always fight again for the chance to save it all.

@nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd
Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 03:07 PM
Inside Cameron Rutherford is two wolves in a perpetual battle of their own for dominance over her faculties, as the saying goes... One represses, as was drilled into by a career in the military. Desensitize, execute, fulfil your tasks for the greater good - don't think about more than what orders have been given, don't feel more than is needed. For the world is cruel, and the weak are eaten and spat out if any moment. Vulnerabilities are exploited when fighting against an enemy that wishes you death. A tool in a well-equipped armamentarium. To feel anything other is detrimental to one's safety and sanity. Any wavering thought, any shaky hand of fear, any sign that one has the slightest doubt in their action is an opportunity to compromise and attack their weaknesses. The other feels, and feels, and feels. It feels so much, an overwhelming warmth that heats and cools, that brings brightness to the world, that lives to experience life's beauty - and its ugliness. For what else is humanness than to live in the moment unabashedly? What is light without the absence of darkness? To share love and joy with others while they still can enjoy it; it wants to help because it can. Because life is always worth living, even if it's tiresome, even if it hurts every day she wakes up, and the guilt of surviving again and again plagues her heart. Because an opportunity to be better and do better should always be taken when it exists. To rebalance the scales. Because it makes her feel happy. Because others' happiness is her happiness. Life is thankless if only seeking out words to fill the void. But emotions are loud and want to be heard. This wolf seeks to listen to the music; create its own compositions. (edited)
15:07
She wants to be heard. In the darkness she grips the back of her neck until crescents pool and trickle. She doesn't even realise how she screams from how sore her throat is. A rotting limb infects the whole body without removal. Gangrenous, necrotic. Poisoning its surrounding neighbors. The wolves snap at each other's necks, coats torn and sodden as hard enamel punctures soft tissue. It's only growing more frantic as the dawning of death grows closer. Now the pendulum loosens. Now the strings fray faster. (edited)
Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 30-Jan-23 03:20 PM
To save herself, she must give up. A sacrifice must be made to a voracious god to appease it from damnation. But what is Cameron Rutherford if a puzzle piece is missing? Her memories, her story, her life - the ugly and the good - is what made her the person she is today...the person she thinks she should be. It's getting hard to remember things the more she hides away from them. It's already inside, burrowing through, breaking down her attempt at defences with little difficulty. How she was broken and remoulded by the military isn't working right now. Hasn't worked for a long time. And yet she still clings to those habits ingrained into her because shutting down is easier to deal with than giving it her full attention. She's crying. The tears run down her cheeks, heavy and wet. She wants to be Cameron, she doesn't want to be anyone else. It's not the Cameron that she portrays herself as that keeps people around her, it's the Cameron she is. For all her flaws and strengths and weaknesses; all the experiences and memories and stories, there are so many to share. So many she's shared already. She keeps fighting because she wants to survive, selfishly. In these impossible odds, how can she maintain her essence? A perfume's notes are entirely different even if one scent is removed. She'll claw her way out of she has to.

You don't want to lose out on anything, and that's another aspect of what makes you, you. To fight for tomorrow, but never at the cost of today is admirable in a way. There are emotions you want to hide, feelings you want to bury away, but at certain moments, you need to let the tears flow. 15:49

The wolves really didn't hold back when they would bite. The blood under her fingernails were starting to dry, her consciousness starting to fade in and out as she took deep breaths to steady herself. It was nice... to be able to think freely. To think of anything else that would bring her mind away from the pool of blood that started to seep into her clothing, to steady her vision against the black spots that would start to make themselves known. She could hear footsteps. There was some kind of comfort in knowing that she wouldn't have to be alone, to be able to close her eyes knowing that someone stood by her side. The low clicking of heels resounded against the floor, rushing into the room with a gasp. Quickly, swiftly, there's pressure on your neck, the maneuvering of a makeshift bandage as it coils around to place pressure on the wound. The comfort that comes with knowing that someone was out there taking care of you. Cameron Rutherford closes her eyes. She deserves the rest for now.

[ mechanisms ] throughout this process, you will have two options to navigate through the course of this journey [ when prompted ]. 1. [ a flat 1d20. ] let the die choose your fate. ;take your chances. 11+ is a save. 10 and below is a fail. 2. [ a narrative explaination. ] your willpower and strength are all you have. ;the catch? you don't know what saves you and what makes you worse. ultimately, it will be your decisions that affect the course of your actions. ultimately, you choose if you live or die. feel free to pick whichever method you'd like to use whenever prompted. nothing is ever set in stone. ADDITIONAL NOTES: - please make all rolls in this channel The jab of a needle. There's no relief that comes with the insertion of something foreign into your body. No high, no euphoria. Just the digging feeling that something wants to eat you up from the inside out. It feels awful, it's painful, but maybe it makes you feel a little like a person. The burning sensation lingers in your throat, clings to the inside of your mouth-- dry and raspy, no voice manages to escape your lips as you try to speak. Instead, your body is dragged along the floor, away from everyone else. Once again you find yourself alone. In a hazy state of mind where no one else can follow. You don't think you can move... narrator 30-Jan-23 05:27 PM
ini [ save ] 2/2 There's a saying that people like to quote often. Stuck onto coffee mugs, or T-Shirts, or added onto those little placards people liked to hang in their homes... but the words are often true, with meaning in themselves. There's no shame in asking for help. It simply means that you're human. There's no need to pretend to not be human, there's no need to act as if you're stronger than everything else. No need to break away from the pain of living. It hurts, it feels awful, it makes you want to dig out your heart at times... but this is also what it means to be alive. To experience each passing day and the emotions that come with it. A life with emotions that run up and down... to brave the deep waters of the unknown with another hand in yours made the journey easier. It's like a walk in the silence of the dark. Frightening, but with another by your side, it seems as if the scary things are cut in half as well. Maybe she'll think of it in the same way. It makes the sunrise that much more rewarding. As you curl up on the floor, you feel nothing more than the emptiness overtake you, the blanket of the cold slowly settling on your body as your cry for help lingers in the air before fading. Your consciousness fades in, fades out, the blazing heat of whatever entered your body seemingly eating you from the inside out. Your vision turns spotty, dark spots slowly encroaching from the corners as you fear you'll slip into the darkness for real. You hear the clicking of footsteps nearby, you hear the sound of a quiet hushed voice whispering in your ear. You feel a cool hand against your cheek, maybe one you'll lean into, imagining it was her. You finally feel the respite of cool waters fill your veins. It's a comforting feeling this time, refreshing even, as it slowly spreads throughout your body, letting you unclench your fists that had your nails digging into your palms.
17:27
Your eyes close, brown hair briefly showing up in your eyes as you finally close them for now. You'll have to remember to make a call to Castell once you wake. [ fin ] THANK YOU FOR PLAYING! @Jacket 🏨 MILF EMPORIUM 💀📞🕷
4
Exported 13 message(s)
LQCC - roof
LQCC
🌙 WHEN THE TWILIGHT BREAKS / roof
narrator 31-Jan-23 11:14 AM
You blink, and you wake. Your body aches from the remnants of the gas that had invaded your body, soreness, raspy throats, a general confusion as to where you were... This certainly wasn't the lobby, nor was it any room you were in before. An empty storage room... one you had been unceremoniously dragged into. As far as you could see, your co-workers were nowhere in sight, and what you had just experienced previously was done so in your little isolated chamber. As for how you got here... You're detectives, try to figure it out. If you step outside the room, gripping the handle of the door and jerking it open, you'd probably recognize the following. You were on the upper floor of the building, there were other doors that were just starting to open, your coworkers, you presume. At the end of the hall is a flight of stairs, leading up. Your instincts (or perhaps it was your memory... wait, what memories?) tell you that you should go that way. Of course, what you do is ultimately up to you. Erika is the first one out, standing in the hallway with a vacant expression on her face. It seemed as if she was following someone, but whoever it was, was nowhere to be seen. Cameron is seated in front of a door, her neck bandaged up in what seems like emergency first aid. She's breathing, she's conscious... but so far, it seems as if she wasn't able to make out who exactly it was that had helped her. She probably needs some assistance in order to move. Hayden, likewise, is curled up in front of a door, wavering in and out of consciousness as she tries to wrack herself together. She's stable, physically... but mentally? There's a semblance of peace that settles in the fact that there's company to be had, that someone had come to help, that soldiers never had to fight their battles alone.
11:14
. Sylvester notices that he suffered no additional physical injuries as a direct result of the experience he had with the anomaly (the standard cough from the gas remains). It would make one question if things were real or not... but if it was experienced, surely it had some kind of reality attached to it. Rena would notice bumpy marks on the back of her neck, a result of the scarring that had occurred thanks to her loss. Whether it was caused by her unconscious scraping of her neck or engraved by someone else... that's another mystery that needs to be solved. Saffron... is still in her room, staring below at the unconscious but breathing body of Frankie Mane. How could one bear to leave the body of someone who had given up his entire heart? What happens next detectives? (edited)

SYLVESTER BOT 31-Jan-23 11:23 AM

Something that could be pondered, but maybe not when trying to clear your throat from something burning, but blissfully not sharp. Laboratory. No more snow. No more cabin. No more gentle rest. Erika (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 11:34 AM
Erika's still disoriented. Confused. It's like something about the world is off, yet she can't quite place her finger on what's shifted. (Maybe it's not the world that's changed. Maybe it's her.) She'd just been following Rosabelle--their client, yes, she vaguely recalls the woman's introduction at the beginning now--when the woman turned the corner and virtually disappeared into thin air. Erika tilts her head, scanning the hallway for sign of the wayward scientist. Nothing. Strange. Weird. But nothing that a detective can't handle. Someone calls her name. Erika turns to the sound of the voice and brightens, her lips curving upwards into a smile that feels almost uncomfortably genuine. "Sylvester!" she exclaims. (Yes, that's right. Sylvester McKinley. "I'm fine," she says, nodding at him. "A little disoriented, but it won't impede my duties, promise. How about you? Are you injured?" She feels a surge of worry.
