narrator 31-Jan-23 12:42 PM
There was the clamoring of foosteps against the stairs, each clang against the metal leading them closer to the the rooftop. Step by step, one by one, they got closer to the roof, and closer to the muffled shouting that made itself apparent from upstairs. The creaky door was pried open, and showed a wide expanse of the room. Where they expected the chill of the wind was instead met with a warm breeze, fresh air courtesy of the multiple plants that covered the rooftop expanse. A greenhouse, one would be able to tell at first glance, thanks to the wide expanse of glass that formed a dome at the top of it all. The night sky was deep behind the windowpanes, the stars that glittered in the heavens hidden behind the metal framing and the light that shone down from above. It was an expanse of warmth in the desolation that surrounded them, the only other signs of movement aside from the people here being the flurry of snow that whistled outside. The detectives weren't the only ones on the rooftop, the previously muffled noises were much clearer now, the sounds of arguments could filter themselves into proper words. A voice that had been heard once before, though it seemed as if it was struggling to speak. "Now hey there, doc, shouldn't we be talking through things? No violence," he coughs before tightening his grip. "...love and peace?" There was a clanging noise as a metal object was kicked in the direction the detectives came from. It spun before skittering to a stop in front of them. The item, was familiar to some of you at this point. ...
12:42
Aster's gun, though this time, it seemed as if a couple more bullets were missing. You hear more pieces of the conversation as it occurs in front of you. "No, listen to me detective, you don't understand. Nikolai... Nikolai's experiment, I can't let it go like this. I can't let him continue like this." "You're the one who doesn't get it. Aster." There's a trace note of bitterness in these words, a lingering regret, a harrowing anger. Emotions that convey themselves as they echo against their surroundings, hang in the air as they fall upon deaf ears. What use were words when their meaning could never be conveyed, if they could never be understood... It's hard to make out who says what until you round the corner, and only then can you make out the struggle between four individuals. Two groups, four people. Cayden and Rosabelle are holding back Aster and Eve respectively. Though they all seem well enough to stand, it's also quite obvious that they didn't manage to make it out completely unscathed. Cayden seems to be gritting his teeth, a smear of blood at his side as he pins Aster's arms behind their back. Even in this weakened state he's in, it looks like those years working as a detective has paid off... enough to at least be able to hold back a frantic researcher who is continuously searching around for their weapon. Rosabelle, while seemingly uninjured, shows obvious signs of struggle. Her hair is a mess, her clothing has minor tears and large streaks of dirt. She's doing all she can to hold Eve back, who looks like she wants to do nothing more than pummel Aster into the ground. It's probably only thanks to the fact that her leg is injured that Rosabelle manages to keep her away. "Eve. This isn't necessary. You know this as well as I do," she mutters under gritted teeth. It's something that you could only catch if you were listening very closely.

Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 01:35 PM
Darkness retreats for light when Cameron opens her eyes again, though her world is tinted red from burst vessels and spotty. It's hard to focus on anything - not only from the haze that hangs over her vision but the immense pain pulsing behind her neck. Her limbs feel numb and cold, immobile, just like when she was dragged away to this place. And she sits here alone, her ragged breaths are the only thing filling the location now in its vacancy. Her breath smells metallic, rare. Her lips rouged from a natural tint of blood that pooled out before someone came to her rescue. Someone...the shoes sounded heeled from what she could gather before she drifted into unconsciousness once more. Where is everyone? It's hard to think when a cloud hangs over her mind. The body works hard to conserve itself when bleeding out; the need to think is a lower priority than keeping a heart pumping what's left of blood around to starving cells. Her core is hot, though, that's all she can truly feel. The heat of surviving, the pressure of her lungs expanding and contracting, the shudder of her heart compressing, the dryness of her mouth, the ache of her wounds. She can still feel.
5
5
saffron coelho. (he/she ) BOT 31-Jan-23 01:48 PM
" yesterday, " saffron begins, wrangling his voice. he doesn't need to yell. the greenhouse alone will make his voice resonate. he doesn't need to carry himself with anything more than a cool, level disposition. " aster said they killed nikolai. or, at least, they tried to. by the sound of it, it seems as though they had failed in their attempt. " " they told us something very valuable then, eve. something about how you kept the failed experiment. about you being an accomplice. about how they didn't know what you or nikolai would do with it. this alone is enough to prove that, at the very least, nikolai is still involved in this grand affair, and not just in the main branch. for whatever reason, he is still dedicated to his project. " he walks forward, though not enough to pass what he could gauge rena's arm length to be. " nikolai was said to be in liam's body before all of this. liam was never alive when we saw him, was he ? by the things i've found, he was dead from the start. no use to think about it now. but this anomaly ... this product of the research you three worked on. this anomaly is here, still. in the facility. it's said to body hop, no ? " " when we found liam completely brain dead, only you and ms. ellis were missing from the scene. you two were also the only ones missing when the rest of us got gassed, and aster told us that nikolai was in you. " he turns to look at aster. he remembers. he remembers. aster, who was there with them at the time, seemed to have been able to escape. they look ... relatively unharmed, even. the man behind them more worse for wear. have they created an antidote to the poison, perhaps ? or maybe there is something else they aren't telling them ? something they can't remember ? he didn't miss it. that look on their face then, when they found liam. what if ... " ... i would appreciate it if one of you could open your goddamn mouths. shed some light on the situation. " or else.

Erika (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 01:56 PM
So here's the sitch: Erika has lost a couple of core memories and thereby may be lacking her Crazy Factor, but it's not like --- shaped her entire personality. Erika is clever, and Erika is quick, and Erika has never been one to shy from danger. (How else would she have gotten into that cultto begin with?) So when she sees several people in a confrontation and her coworkers rush to stop it, Erika only takes a second to think about it before bulldozing onto the scene. "Rosabelle, dearest!" she says, throwing an arm around the scientist and giving the woman a mournful look. Fluttery eyelashes and all. "Terrible of you, to ditch me like that without saying a word. I'm a patient! Convalescing! And you leave me behind in a nasty little corridor with the brightest fluorescent lights known to man!" Erika is a showmaker. Always has been. Once upon a time, it had been music. Here, it's drama. Her smile stays intact even as she fishes the photo out of her pocket. Aster, Nikolai, and Eve. What secrets does this story hold? She dangles the photograph in front of Eve's face, waving it almost tauntingly. "Aster said your wayward boyfriend's six feet under a pile of snow," she says to Eve, smiley as ever. "Care to shed some light on that? Or do we have to dig up the man's corpse before we can start getting some answers?" @narrator
narrator 31-Jan-23 02:02 PM
There's the slight groaning noise as Cayden finally collapses onto the ground, hand clenched against the side where the blossoming of red spread against the white shirt he wore. His face was pale, but for now it seemed as if it wasn't... too life threatening. Not yet at least. He seems to be in too much pain to say anything yet. Aster lunges ahead in the chaos, taking the opportunity where Eve is stunned into silence in order to push Rosabelle and Erika out of the way, causing them to trip and fall back, out of the way where she hits her head against the edge of a pot, body shifting to protect Erika from harm. A low cracking noise as terracotta shards fall onto the ground, a small pool of blood forming beneath the tangled mess of their limbs. The photograph gets smeared in blood, an ominous note. Eve, now pinned under Aster's arms, reaches out for the photograph, arm flaying as if to try and grab it out of Erika's reach. Her mouth opens, as if to speak, but is immediately cut off by Aster's words. "Eve-- no, Nikolai. Why. Why. Why. Who are you, what do I call you. How could you betray me. Betray Eve, betray everyone here like this." There are tears in their eyes, pooling against the rims before dropping onto Eve's cheeks, her head jerking to the side as she struggles to get them off of her. Aster shakes, trembles, their shoulders heaving as their fingers fumble for Eve's neck. They have no strength in their hands, no power in their grip. They desperately look towards the detectives, and at the gun in Rena's hand. Please hand it over. They mouth. Even if the words carry no sound, the meaning was as clear as day. Please let me fix these mistakes, please let me correct what's gone wrong. @twilight

Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 02:11 PM
A gunshot had cracked the air - it feels like a week ago, or maybe an hour or maybe this exact moment, Regulating time is like a tease of a toxic lover, how it slips out of her grasp whenever she's grown too comfortable with its consistency. Whenever she starts to feel normal. She still needs to do a head count. A headcount to make sure everyone is ok. Safe. Accounted. That everyone didn't have the black mass coursed through her vessels and sought to make her mind its. It might've been a day they were missing, a couple minutes? The wolves have quieted their battle from exhaustion. The dullness feels like static in her brain as the soldier commands her limbs to react. Adrenaline. Mind over matter.

Erika (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 02:18 PM

Rosabelle's hair is red‚Äîit's pretty, like the last vestiges of sunset before twilight paints the sky violet. Her hair feels matted. Sticky. Erika lets out a strangled sound as she tries to pull away. There is red on her hands. (Blood. Blood pooling beneath their intertwined bodies, blood collected in neat sterilized tubes as masked figures loom over her and Erika screams.). The photo is still in her hands. Somehow, miraculously, in all the chaos, the photo is intact. Erika looks at it. Looks at the scientists' smiling faces, a fleeting moment of happiness captured and immortalized. Earlier, Erika had empathized with Aster. Why exactly she felt such empathy remains unclear. It's like static in her head, white noise that drowns out the steady rhythm of her heartbeat. Steady, steady, steady. (Cries of betrayal echo in her ears, and Erika feels like the world is melting around her, like something is trying to claw its way out of her chest, like she is a pressurized bottle ready to explode.) "Give them the gun," she rasps, and she doesn't know why she says it. Empathy? Pity? Fear? Erika doesn't know what the right decision is. She just knows with startling clarity that this is something she wants. Rosabelle is still down. Erika sits up, cradling the woman's still figure in her lap. She feels like a woman possessed. There are no flashes of her existence in a span of an instant. Merely a stillness held in suspension while she moves towards to the other side of this tunnel - no, hallway? The steel doors are closed on both sides. She's still hurting and breathing, more attached to this mortal coil than in other instances. Maybe she's still fighting for a chance, and her soul will be pulled back into her body. Purgatory? Will she search for them until the end of time? Time? This doesn't matter, she needs to move. saffron coelho. (he/she ) BOT 31-Jan-23 04:38 PM
a bullet tearing through muscle, burning, burning, burning, saffron can't help the sound that rips out of his throat before he cuts it off with a grit of his teeth. the adrenaline is high, the threat is high, and he doesn't allow something like this to take him down. he tenses up at the sight of rena preparing another shot, and for her sake, he decides to make things all the more easier for her. saffron grabs ahold of the woman by her hair and one of her arms, fingers winding tighty into snowy locks. he pulls hard, enough that it's shy of twisting her neck entirely, winding her around so that their positions are reversed. for a moment, he sees rena past eve's shoulder -- sees her eyes, spelling out something. he doesn't care for it.

Cameron Rutherford (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 04:55 PM
It's unironically comforting somehow currently, the gunfire. Not so much the cause and eventual aftermath but the clatter that rips through the air, that filled her days and nights in her early adulthood. What she'd wake and sleep to, keeping small and hidden so she could avoid the path of incoming bullets. "Their ears are gonna be fucked," she murmurs as she chuckles in her mind. There is little difference between the sound of a suppressed and unsuppressed firearm, but the damage done is significant, 140 db is the threshold for experiencing pain, and a Glock alone can reach 165. "...We should'a left after the papers...people interrogatin', stickin' their noses in places...we could'a jus' handed the stuff to authorities...we're a liability now." @Jacket 🏨 MILF EMPORIUM 💀📞🕷

narrator 31-Jan-23 04:56 PM
You see it spell something. Eve's eyes do the same, as her head jerks to face her looming end. It's fear. Fear of death. Fear of the end. But underneath all of that fear... You see it's an expression of love. Can you understand this kind of love? A love that hides itself, a love that buries itself, a love that twists and turns in so many different directions so that it doesn't make sense to the people watching. It never makes sense. Because love never makes sense in the first place. It's an emotion that makes you do the most awful things, justify the cruelest methods, and brings you into a circle of guilt that spirals down endlessly. This too is a type of love. But that sentence is cut off before it can explain itself. cw: mentions of blood, of murder, and of death. The bullet lodges itself into Eve's heart, a well calculated angle that splits the entry far from Saffron's own body. She lurches forward, a cough of blood that falls from her mouth as she slumps onto the ground, head lulling forward as there's nothing left to keep it standing. The light from her eyes fade, and the shock of it all is apparent in the eyes of those watching. What was supposed to be a job that required you to do nothing but retrieve a couple of documents had descended into this madness, a story with its own twists and turns that made everything that much more painful. Her body falls in the arms of Saffron Coelho, a limp body not too different from the same one you, Saffron, held in your arms not too long ago. The only difference was that she no longer breathed. You wonder for a moment, if he did so as well. If anything, there's a silence that settles in the room as everyone stares at the events that occurred, broken only by the clattering noise as Cayden drops his gun, and shuts his eyes, a low sigh as he breathes out against the pain. In the end, he didn't do much, but maybe it was his presence that made all the difference. For now, he shuts his eyes. .
16:56
For now, it seems as if the story can end here, to wrap itself up as the villain is finally dead. Funny enough how "Eve" had clamored about this supposed immortality, only for her to never stir again, her lifeless body limp with no signs of stirring. What was it all for in the end? There's no one left to ask. But that's too simple of an ending for a story as complex as this, with twists and turns that are half expected, half shocking. Some things only reveal themselves when it's too late, when the pages have already been torn and burnt, with no more opportunity to change them back. Erika, you notice the stirring of the body you hold close. It's a miracle how Rosabelle has been able to stay warm this whole time. A miracle, how despite the amount of blood she had been losing, she still managed to breathe. Maybe your prayers have been answered after all. Maybe it was alright to just believe... If only it was that easy. Rosabelle rises, a low sigh heaving through her voice as she sits herself up. The blood on her head mattes the back of her hair, a tangled mess now that the blood had started to dry off. Still, this means almost nothing to her as she wipes a sleeve across her cheek before turning to look at the situation at hand. Cayden, collapsed onto the ground. Aster, in shock. Eve, dead. Detectives... some were injured, some were fine. Ultimately this wasn't the finale that they wanted to write. "Eve... why did you have to lie like that."

Erika (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 05:08 PM

Angel, she thinks, only that's wrong. Those which rise from the dead are far from heaven's soldiers. Rosabelle, the very first person they encountered on their mission. The anomaly hadn't answered then, but perhaps its silence was all the more telling.) She doesn't rise from the floor. Her legs are numb, her knees anchored to the ground by a weight she can't comprehend. She tilts her head upwards and stares at Rosabelle, searching for answers. Searching for a sign. Fate, Rosabelle had called their meeting. Perhaps it was fate that guided us together. "Why?" Erika asks, on her knees. Searching for divine enlightenment. "Why us?" @narrator

SYLVESTER BOT 31-Jan-23 05:18 PM
What makes a person? A simple question, with perhaps, millennia of baggage attached to it, a ball and chain that will continue to weigh down the world and all the fools that inhabit it. Was it the body we possess? Was it the brain, the mental faculties that guided our decisions, was it the actions, the marks we left on the ground we walk? Was it the gaze of others, looking upon us, deciding with their own predilections, this one is someone we care about, and this one isn‚Äôt. This one is not a person. This is an obstacle. A threat. A prop. A side-character. A person was lived experiences. A person was a smile and a laugh, an image in a doorway telling you that you should go to bed, its getting late. A person was a mass of meat, bleeding out on cement. The emotions flew high and Sylvester was pallid in comparison, hanging in the background. Memories, that always came up, memories, the record of the combination of it all, an archive of infinite seconds spanning through a life time, every waking moment, fading, fleeting, some sharp as glass, some muddled through the lens of time. Burning through it for the body. He remembered briefly, a fleeting thought of anomaly sample codes, a lingering regret of Art left behind. The anomaly samples‚Äî Was it someone‚Äôs memories? Another persons fleeting remnants, inhaled, injected‚Äî Too many gaps still left to fill. Rosabelle was willing to answer. Erika (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 05:23 PM

Maybe it's foolish to care, but Erika Steinitz once loved as easily as she breathed, and that flicker of love for this stranger, for her friends, for the fallen hasn't gone out yet. narrator 31-Jan-23 05:28 PM
She tilts her head to the side, expression almost unreadable as she tried to recollect her thoughts. Was it a wave of guilt that washed over her face? Or was it something else, something impossible to read... "There are," she begins, pausing in between words. "--some things that you got right..." She takes a quick glance in Aster's direction. "And some things that have gotten heavily convoluted." She pauses again, eyes shut in order to remember... to think... "Let's see, it was two years ago when I was with Aid-- Aster." She shakes her head. "Memories do tend to get confused sometimes, I'll speak with as little error as possible if you'll be so kind to have a bit of patience." She makes no mind of the gun trained upon her, and instead waves her hand to continue her story. "Aster and I were researching anomalies, ones that would help human recovery. Speed up the process of natural human healing, and such as that. You might be a little familiar with it." She nods her head in Sylvester's direction, a nod acknowledging the gun that fell off the ledge, and another nod as if there was a small secret shared between the two. Samples and components. "Those details are hardly important, but the fact of the matter was that as a side effect of healing, people would lose their memory, and as a byproduct of the healing, we developed a mechanism to transfer human memories and consciousness between bodies. There were several branches of this research that was split between the assistant team... Eve... was the one developing the gas in order to..." She sighed, it was difficult to speak of it now. Now that the consequences of their actions were laid in front of them. "The accident really was an accident. Aster and I..." She slowly turns her head towards Aster, a pained expression on her face. "...died there." (edited)

narrator 31-Jan-23 05:44 PM
It's at this moment where the expression on Aster's face falls, a sinking feeling in the pit of their stomach where everything that didn't make sense seems to fall into place, where everything that had felt so odd started to click together. "What do you mean we died. We're here and breathing-- I'm still here and breathing-- how did." They clutch their head in their hands, shutting their eyes as if that would keep the truth away. Instead, Rosabelle continues to speak. "Well... no. I suppose it's more accurate to say we nearly died. Hanging onto the vestiges of life... I didn't want to see everything we worked for and..." she paused for a moment, hesitation on her lips as she carefully chose her next words. "... let's just say I didn't want to die, alright? So I used the capsule to heal us... but in return." She tapped a finger against her head. "I don't remember anything about Nikolai Levinsky's life from the ages of ten to twenty-nine." A high cost. "The rest of the story is a little dramatic, so I'll get to the important parts of it. Aster lost short-term memories for a while. Their recollection of the events only got worse after I revealed the truth." She speaks quickly, as if she can get out as many sentences as she could while Aster was in a dumbfounded state. "Turns out that the anomaly can quickly heal the body... but just as well removes anything that could be considered an external stress. Aster lost their memories about the accident, and only started to fill in bits and pieces after a while." "As for how I got into... as you guessed, Liam and Rosabelle's bodies." She holds her hands up to the detectives, as if telling them to pause. "Liam was already dead, nearly dying. He was caught out in the snowstorm and was dying of hypothermia. My memories were breaking down after trying to repair the gunshot wound and Eve... transferred me." @twilight

Erika (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 05:58 PM

narrator 31-Jan-23 06:21 PM
"I..." She pauses for a moment. "I'd like to finish what I came for... and then probably lay on the snow for some time." She smiles wistfully. The events of this evening were stressful to the mind, and the anomaly will target those before anything else. With the rest of the facility destroyed, there'll be no opportunity for anymore transfers to happen." "And I'll disappear too. I don't think both of us can make it through. SYLVESTER BOT 31-Jan-23 06:37 PM

narrator 31-Jan-23 06:58 PM

narrator 31-Jan-23 07:18 PM
What hurts more than the wounds that regenerate themselves is the look of loss in Aster's eyes. The vacant gaze that struggled to understand what it was that was going on in the middle of the night. The fear as they found themselves in the arms of a crying person, whose face they couldn't recognize. The shudder in their body in the cold as they see nothing but blood. Blood. The deep red that seemed to spread into the cracks on the roofing, the sticky feel that was on their fingers, with no way for them the explain how it came across in the first place. A body with clothing riddled into holes, where wounds have patched themselves up so that nothing had happened in the first place. Aster was brilliant, with a mind that could quickly put one and two together. It wasn't difficult to hypothesize what had happened. They shook, shivered. But it wasn't thanks to the cold. It was the fear of the unknown, with not a single thing in sight that could breed familiarity. @twilight

Erika (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 07:26 PM
"Stop, stop, stop!" Erika shouts because--because--she sees Aster's personhood slipping right before her very eyes. To be a person is to know oneself. To be a person is to feel one's heartbeat, to breathe the air, to see the world and think: Yes, I exist, I am here, I breathe, I live, I love. To be a person is to define oneself beyond relationships with others. It's being more than someone's partner, more than someone's friend, more than someone's brother, more than someone's daughter. It is being you, in everything that entails: it is knowing who you are, knowing what you like, defining yourself by your experiences and your interests alone. And Aster is losing it. She's watching their personhood being destroyed before her very eyes. This is not murder--this is not anything so kind. This is destruction, in its most primordial form, and Erika knows better than to play the role of God. This is sacrilege. This is sin. This is evil.

narrator 31-Jan-23 07:44 PM
What sins have they committed? Answer. Answer the question. Was it to struggle to stay alive? To do things that any other ordinary person would do? You did the same. You ripped out a heart to save yourself. To become whole. To accept what you wanted to have. Wasn't it the same thing? To take what you can to preserve the essence of your being? What wrong did they do. Aster didn't know. Aster never killed. Aster only sought to make things right. Aster likes to stare at the rising sun with a mug of hot tea. Aster loves to read the comics in the newspaper, as silly as they seem after a day of hard work. Aster likes to read magazines that show new recipes, even though they don't know how to cook at all. Nikolai wanted to see Aster smile. Nikolai asked Eve to help, to hide the data, to make sure everything would be fine, so that he could disappear and hide away the fact that their lives were hanging on a precarious balance. Nikolai helped you all. Who do you think it was that ran through every room, making sure your coworkers didn't die, making sure that the largest number of people would survive. Who do you think was giving you hints throughout the evening, trying to tell you how to make it through, to make it so that you would be able to see the dawn of the next day. Who are you to become the judge and the executioner? You are a detective. You are here to investigate, to find things, to protect Rosabelle Ellis in the case of an anomalous scenario. You have already failed those tasks. So why do you think you can resolve yourself to take on another? @MUTE 🐇 saffron

narrator 31-Jan-23 07:48 PM
Rosabelle Ellis and Aster Vaughan exist. Physically. What was it again that made a person? Was it their memories, or their emotions, or their body? Each person has their own answer to the question, and at a first glance, it would be easy enough to say that they were fine. Physically, they were. It was the truth. But if you considered a person to be the conjunction of both the mind, body, and soul to tie it all together, then it was easier to say that their status was that of something not quite alive, but also not quite dead. They existed, they breathed, they had tears run down their cheeks, but one knew too much and one knew nothing at all. @twendychu 🌱 sylvester @twilight

Erika (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 08:04 PM
Insanity. Evil. Destruction. Erika looks at Saffron and wonders what led her to this path, wonders what drove her to what extremes. Without the insight of her past memories, Erika can't even begin to comprehend her coworker's scene of judgment, her coworker's moment of madness. She takes a step back. Then another. Then another. Compartmentalize. Erika is good at doing that. She is magnificent at focusing on what matters, focusing on what she can do. Her voice does not reach Saffron, not with their past relationship as frayed as it is. They are ships sailing across the same sea, with leagues between them. She will not reach her. She looks at Rosabelle. She sees the tears streaming down her‚Äîhis‚Äîtheir? cheeks. She sees the way Rosabelle trembles, the way they breathe, the way they look like empty human beings. Blank slates. No meaning, no purpose, no soul. "It's okay," Erika breathes, and she isn't sure if she's really talking to Rosabelle or someone else. She sees someone lost, someone lonely, someone lovelorn. She sees a monster without personhood, and for some reason she can not comprehend, Erika feels the desperate need to speak. "It's okay," she repeats, voice trembling. Her eyes are wide. As she speaks, the words tumble out faster and faster, as if she's trying to convince herself as much as Rosabelle. "It's okay, you can always. Always. Remake yourself. You can find yourself. You can forge yourself anew. It's okay to not exist, because‚Äî" Erika chokes on her own words, like they're not hers to own. Like she's echoing someone else. "‚Äîbecause you can make a new you," she says. She vows. She is on the cusp of something, on finding something, on remembering something important. And all of a sudden, it vanishes. The faint visage of a woman's back, walking away. Erika falls silent. narrator 31-Jan-23 08:12 PM
You could reinvent yourself from a blank slate, that much was true... But what if the materials were disjointed? Blackboard, whiteboard, corkboard. Three materials haphazardly cut together and strewn with twine. Each requiring a different type of material to make marks. Chalk, marker, pushpin. What happens when the materials are far too great and the instruments of writing are too few? Erika has good intentions, but none of them are helpful for Rosabelle, if you can call her Rosabelle still at this point. There's a fundamental difference between the two. Erika can take a step forward and carve into the stone that is her slate, Rosabelle is fragmented beyond imagination, a burning gas lamp with no more fuel left in sight. There's the difference between a light that shines from within itself, and the burning of the last wick of a candle. It's okay, it's okay. She wishes she could believe those worse, to coo them into Aster's ears for them to hear as well. Erika's words fall upon deaf ears. But maybe it's fine if she just repeats it for herself. @cam ‚òò erika
Erika (she/her) BOT 31-Jan-23 08:28 PM
"Right," Erika breathes, and a nervous giggle escapes her lips. "Right, right. Ambulance. Has the snowstorm settled down yet? I could really use a drink. Or two. Or three." Her hands are trembling. Her entire body is trembling, actually. She can't help it: a tremor runs through her, offputting and cold. (Always cold, this winter. How she hates the winters here. All Erika wants to do is melt into a puddle and disappear, into the air, into the clouds‚Äîet the wind take her somewhere she can rest, somewhere she can see, somewhere she doesn't have to be.) "Kidding," she adds, just because. "I'm kidding." Rosabelle does not move. Aster does not move. Erika has just witnessed an annihilation, and she has done nothing to stop it. It makes her sick. It makes bile rise to her throat. Guilt claws in her chest. Sorrow pulls at her feet, trying to make her fold like a house of cards. She does not hate Saffron. She can't. She's too drained for anything like that. All she wants is home, or whatever closest approximation she has to it. She wants to return to the cabins and bury herself underneath layers and layers and pretend nothing ever happened. She wants to seek out someone to ground her‚ÄîOrion, Oliver, hell...she'll even take Frankie. She wants to feel the sunlight so badly, and never have the cloudy skies near Meteor City felt worse than today. "I'm done," she says, and she does not have the courage to face Rosabelle, to face Aster. She turns away from Sylvester, from Saffron. (Shame on you, something in her whispers, and she withers. Shame, shame, shame.) Her steps are mechanical. Someone else can take care of the mess. She stops at the door of the rooftop and sags against the frame, her whole body trembling from exertion. Exhales. Turns around, with the last vestiges of her strength (her courage), and waits for her fellow detectives to join her on the trek home.

saffron coelho. (he/she ) BOT 31-Jan-23 08:35 PM
erika has left. it's just the four of them, now. just them. three scientists, two murderers, one big circus. it's a moment of silence, before he wills himself to speak. " this building, " saffron begins, slowly, the world feeling as though it's beginning to float, piece by piece, brick by brick. his head is pounding. his heart is beating too fast. the wound on his leg weeps, desperate for attention. he ignores it, in favor of hauling himself up from where he had been slouched over. he stumbles pathetically, only to steady himself on a beam. " ... is going down. if all goes to its plan, this facility will not be here, come the dawn. isn't that right ? narrator 31-Jan-23 08:50 PM

narrator 31-Jan-23 09:39 PM
Somehow, the detectives manage to leave the rooftop, leaving a seated Rosabelle alone in a pool of blood. She says nothing as you leave, keeping her eyes fixed on your backs as you walk out the door. Her hand twitches as if to raise her arm and beg you not to go, not to leave her alone, because there's still so many people she wanted to talk to, wanted to be with. There was Aster and Eve, who stuck by her side throughout everything that had happened. There was Mylah, who had always caressed her cheek so lovingly, who she promised to take a winter's trip in the snowy mountains. Then there was Aiden. Aiden, dearest Aiden. Aiden who introduced her to the detective he worked with, who laughed with her, who held her hand, who made a promise to her, that he would never let her be alone, would never let her face the harsh cold of the world without him by her side. She held back her tears when she realized she could never keep this promise. In the end, who was she? A mix of three memories in one body. A mix of three souls that lingered within the vestiges of her mind. She could only wait until she heard the fading of the footsteps that signaled the exit of the detectives before she let her body wrack with sobs, with tears she had held back before. Nikolai Levinsky did everything he needed, achieved everything he had sought out to do. But Nikolai Levinsky was not the same as Rosabelle Ellis, and it was her tears that flowed down her cheeks, as the last part of her soul remembered what she would never be able to reach again. She didn't want to die alone. . (edited)
21:39
It takes a while, until the detectives finally step out into the snow. It's cold, but the wind has stopped howling, and there was a sheer silence that hung in the air as the crunching sound of their footsteps made their own tracks. Aster wakes, finally blearily opening their eyes as they press their palms against Sylvester's back as if a sharp realization hits them. A fresh out look as their vision clears, a focus sharpening in their mind as they stand on their own two feet, seemingly healthier than ever, a faint red brushing against their cheeks as boyish wonder spreads across their face. "I--" The detectives could struggle, and try to hold them back, but it was impossible. Those capable of moving were encumbered by the bodies of their colleagues, the others were too tired to even move. They pushed you aside with a laugh, shaking their head against any protests. "Nikolai's still in there. You all go ahead without me. Tell Eve that we'll bring the documents to the showcase tomorrow. You've all worked so hard, take the night off and we'll finish everything up." They smile at you, all previous grievances already forgotten, as they run back towards the door. Perhaps they mistook you for something else, a group of assistants on the night before a showcase. A night where they would send you off to rest and recuperate before they would follow through the next day. The night before an accident that would shift the trajectory of their lives. As much as you want to do so, you can't stop them from going, and for a moment in time, it feels as if you're watching a tape replay from two years prior. Perhaps this was the last moment they had felt happiness... Perhaps that was one saving grace that had been granted to them. But when a story is retold, the ending has already made itself clear. There's no opportunity for you to hold them back, so all you can do is watch them run inside, rush in through those metal doors, and sit there with baited breath. . (edited)
21:39
The twilight breaks, and the sun starts to rise, peeking the sun's rays against the snow covered mountaintop. It would be a beautiful sight... if only you didn't know what would follow after. A resounding bang, a building full of sparks, a loud crashing noise as flames start to lick away at the building. Everyone is far enough that the debris doesn't hit... but perhaps you can feel the warmth coming from the flames as you watch the building fall apart in silence, until the sound of helicopters and blaring roar of trucks come to your aid. Perhaps you can hear the faint sound of laughter of two people who remember nothing but bliss in the present. FIN. thank you for playing!
